abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Financial and Enterprise
            Sector Adjustment Loan Credit Project will support the
            Government's sector reform program, to accelerate
            private sector growth, by strengthening the banking system,
            and improving the quality of bank inter-mediation. In
            addition, the project will enable an environment for private
            sector growth, and, resolve, through privatization/financial
            restructuring, or closure, the losses that preclude
            enterprises to succeed within the private sector. The
            project will foster job creation within the private sector,
            supported by a strong financial system, and, it is expected
            that the program would lead to a decline in the current
            levels of nominal, and real interest rates, and to a
            concomitant increase in domestic savings, and financial
            sector inter-mediation, which would generate working
            capital, and investment finance needed for private sector
            modernization, and expansion. However, there is the
            potential risk of an eventual weakening of political
            commitment to resolve large loss-making enterprises; but,
            the Social Support Project would partially mitigate this
            risk, by financing severance payments among such
            enterprises. Weak institutional capacity is another risk
            which is to be mitigated by accompanying donor funded
            technical assistance projects, and, the risk of renewed
            regional instability is reduced by the recent political
            events in the Former Yugoslavia.
